p:
The source of the Italian population is still unknown. It is not ascertained whether ibises originated from individuals who have escaped locally from zoological gardens, collectors, or breeders
72 , or if the Italian settlements have originated from individuals dispersing from the French populations. The first observations of free ranging sacred ibises in Italy were recorded in different regions (Piemonte 1998, Emilia 1991, Friuli 1988), without a geographic trend
73 . These data support the hypothesis of local escapes with respect to a progressive diffusion from western Italy near France towards the east. Future genetic studies
74 could clarify whether Italian ibis populations pertain to different founder events, or are the descendants of a single original nucleus.
